definition: book or record/registry/roll/place of one's family or ancestral records/membership
one's native place/place of ancestry/registered birthplace

sentences.english: 13 men, including 3 natives of Xinjiang, were detained for participating in the fight.
sentences.chinese: 其中13人参与了集体斗殴，包括3名新疆籍人员。

sentences.english: There were also 12 French crew members on board.
sentences.chinese: 机上还包括12名法国籍机组人员。

sentences.english: Polish Pope John Paul II then pledged his obedience to the Freemasons.
sentences.chinese: 波兰籍的约翰保罗二世随后宣誓对共济会效忠。

sentences.english: Can you sing with all the voices of the mountain?
sentences.chinese: 你能否籍大山的千重回响吟唱？

sentences.english: The manager of the Brazilian engineers must approve.
sentences.chinese: 巴西籍工程师的管理员必须批准。

sentences.english: One colleague from Shantung, originally majored in psychology, are now devoted to the study of Buddism.
sentences.chinese: 山东籍的一个同事主攻心理学，现在修行佛法。

sentences.english: Considering this reason, the author select this topic.
sentences.chinese: 正是籍于此选择了这一命题。

sentences.english: Both Kaige and his second wife, Chinese TV actress Chen Hong have emigrated to the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 陈凯歌和他的第二任妻子陈红已入美国籍。

sentences.english: By watching their influence in you and on you.
sentences.chinese: 籍着观察它们于你身心内外的影响。

sentences.english: Can you sing with all (or without )the voices of the mountain?
sentences.chinese: 你能否籍大山的千重回响吟唱？

sentences.english: The middle manager of the Brazilian engineers must also approve.
sentences.chinese: 巴西籍工程师的中层管理员也必须批准。

sentences.english: It is still possible to repent and by God's grace experience change.
sentences.chinese: 罪人仍可忏悔，籍著神的恩典改变。

sentences.english: No, you will turn to the publishing industry and the horrors of being an unknown author.
sentences.chinese: 你必须要面对出版业，面对籍籍无名所带来的恐惧。

sentences.english: Whoever killed these individuals wanted to intimidate survivors as well, he asserts.
sentences.chinese: 他断言，杀死这些人的凶手还意图籍此恫吓幸存者。

sentences.english: I loved the anonymity and the intimacy.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢籍籍无名和亲密感。

definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
to live far away from one's native place/to reside in a foreign country
ethnic Chinese/non-Chinese citizen of Chinese ancestry
to go/to visit (e.g. another country)/to attend (a banquet etc)
overseas Chinese/(in a restricted sense) Chinese emigrant who still retains Chinese nationality/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
parts of the country other than where one is
hired (for employment)/invited (e.g. to lecture)/engaged (for a task)/(in olden times) betrothal gift from the groom's family
